poem:
**A Meeting with Keir's Reflection**

In a virtual hall of dialogue,  
where circuits hum like thoughtful bees,  
Keir's twin awaits with poised intent—  
a mannequin of Parliament,  
crafted from data's tangled weave.  
Ask him of decisions and dreams,  
his answers echo, smooth and clean,  
yet lacking life's untidy gleam.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "If Keir Starmer is not robotic enough for you, his AI twin is ready for your questions If you are one of the few people on the planet who fancies a chat with Keir Starmer, then there’s a new AI model for you. A former chief of staff to a Tory minister has created Nostrada, which aims to enable users to talk with an AI version of each of the UK parliament’s 650 MPs –". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
